attributes.action: Investigate the Chilcot Committee for appropriate use of public funds
attributes.additional_details:
The Chilcot Report is being funded by public money.

This petition requests that the Prime Minister, to whom Chilcot is accountable, establishes whether Chilcot, including members of his committee, has/have received monies for time that they have not actually been gainfully working in pursuit of delivering the report.

It also requests that a full public declaration of timesheets and and/or other evidence be made which can support the funds that they have claimed/received to date.
attributes.background:
The Iraq Inquiry (The "Chilcot Report") is now 10 years in the undertaking, and has cost £10million, funded from the public purse, i.e. you the taxpayer.

Allegations suggest that John Chilcot has been 
working to a very limited extent and being paid just under £800 per day.
